graphs.name: Graph BFS — Adjacency List
graphs.description: Perform a breadth-first search on a graph represented by an adjacency list, starting from a given node. Return the order in which nodes are visited.
graphs.signature: def bfs(graph: Dict[int, List[int]], start: int) -> List[int]:

graphs.name: Graph DFS — Adjacency List
graphs.description: Perform a depth-first search on a graph represented by an adjacency list, starting from a given node. Return the order in which nodes are visited.
graphs.signature: def dfs(graph: Dict[int, List[int]], start: int) -> List[int]:

graphs.name: Grid DFS — Count Islands
graphs.description: Given a 2D grid of 0s and 1s, compute the number of connected components of 1s using DFS. Connections are allowed only up, down, left, and right.

graphs.name: Topological Sort — Kahn's Algorithm
graphs.description: Given a directed acyclic graph, return a valid topological ordering of its nodes using Kahn’s algorithm based on indegree and BFS.
graphs.signature: def topological_sort(num_nodes: int, edges: List[List[int]]) -> List[int]:

graphs.name: Cycle Detection — Directed Graph
graphs.description: Given a directed graph, detect whether it contains a cycle using DFS with a recursion-stack or color-marking method. Return True if a cycle exists.
graphs.signature: def has_cycle_directed(num_nodes: int, edges: List[List[int]]) -> bool:

graphs.name: Cycle Detection — Undirected Graph
graphs.description: Detect whether an undirected graph contains a cycle by running DFS and tracking the parent of each visited node. Return True if a cycle is found.
graphs.signature: def has_cycle_undirected(num_nodes: int, edges: List[List[int]]) -> bool:

graphs.name: Connected Components — DFS Count
graphs.description: Given a graph, count how many connected components it contains using DFS or BFS. Nodes may be labeled 0 through n-1.
graphs.signature: def count_components(num_nodes: int, edges: List[List[int]]) -> int:

graphs.name: Dijkstra — Shortest Path
graphs.description: Given a weighted directed graph and a source node, compute the shortest path distance to all nodes using Dijkstra’s algorithm with a priority queue.
graphs.signature: def dijkstra(n: int, edges: List[List[int]], start: int) -> List[int]:

graphs.name: Graph — Bipartite Check
graphs.description: Determine whether an undirected graph is bipartite by coloring nodes using BFS or DFS and checking for conflicting colors.
